1.verse: Mourning and Repentance in Judea -Chapter 1 -The Countryside Is Ravaged. -This is the word of the Lord that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel:

2.verse: Hear this, you elders!Listen to me, all you inhabitants of the land!Has anything like this ever happened in your daysor in the days of your ancestors?

3.verse: Tell your children about it,and let them relate it to their children,and their children to the next generation.

4.verse: What the cutting locust left,the swarming locust has eaten.What the swarming locust left,the hopping locust has eaten.And what the hopping locust left,the destroying locust has eaten.

5.verse: Wake up, you drunkards, and weep!Lament, all you winedrinkers!For the juice of the grapewill be snatched from your mouth.

6.verse: For a nation has invaded my land,powerful and too vast to count,possessing teeth like those of a lion,and the fangs of a lioness.

7.verse: It has laid waste my vinesand destroyed my fig trees,stripping off their barkand leaving their branches white.

8.verse: Lament like a virgin garbed in sackclothgrieving for the betrothed of her youth.

9.verse: Grain offerings and drink offerings are cut offfrom the house of the Lord.The priests, the ministers of the Lord,are in mourning.

10.verse: The fields are destroyed;the earth mourns.The grain has been ruined;the wine has dried up;the oil has failed.

11.verse: Despair, you farmers,and wail, you vinedressers,over the wheat and the barley;the harvest of the fields is lost.

12.verse: The vine has withered;the fig tree droops.The pomegranate, the palm, and the apple tree—all the trees of the field have dried up.And the joy of the peoplehas also withered away.

13.verse: Announce a Holy Fast; Proclaim a Solemn Assembly -Put on sackcloth and lament, you priests!Wail, you ministers of the altar!Come, pass the entire night in sackcloth,you ministers of my God!For the house of your God is deprivedof grain offerings and libations.

14.verse: Announce a holy fast;proclaim a solemn assembly.Summon the eldersand all the inhabitants of the landto the house of the Lord, your God,and cry out to the Lord.

15.verse: Woe to us on that day!For the day of the Lord is near,coming as destruction from the Almighty.

16.verse: Has not the food been cut offbefore our very eyes?Have not joy and gladness disappearedfrom the house of our God?

17.verse: The seed has shriveled under the clods;the storehouses are empty,and the granaries are desertedbecause the grain has dried up.

18.verse: How loudly the cattle groan!The herds of oxen are bewilderedbecause they have no pasture;even the flocks of sheep are wasting away.

19.verse: To you, O Lord, I cry,for fire has consumed the open pasturesand flames have destroyed every tree in the countryside.

20.verse: Even the beasts of the fieldcry out to you.For the streams of water have dried up,and fire has devoured the open pastures.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -The Day of the Lord Is Coming -Blow the trumpet in Zion;sound the alarm on my holy mountain.Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble,for the day of the Lord is coming.

2.verse: A day of darkness and gloom is near,a day of clouds and blackness.Like the dawn spreading over the mountains,a vast and powerful army approaches.Their like has never been seen,nor will it ever be seen againin the ages to come.

3.verse: Their vanguard is a devouring fire,while behind them is a consuming flame.Ahead of them the land is like the Garden of Eden,but behind them lies a desert waste,and from that army there is no escape.

4.verse: They have the appearance of horses;like cavalry they charge.

5.verse: They leap over the mountaintopswith a deafening din like that of chariots,like the crackling of a blazing firedevouring stubble,like a mighty armydrawn up for battle.

6.verse: At the sight of thempeople shrink back in anguish,their faces without color.

7.verse: Like warriors they press forward;like soldiers they scale the walls.They advance, marching straight ahead,without swerving from their paths.

8.verse: They do not jostle one another;each marches straight ahead.They surge through defenseswithout breaking ranks.

9.verse: They burst ahead to assault the city,leaping onto the walls.They climb into the houses,entering like thieves through the windows.

10.verse: As they move forward,the earth quakes before themand the heavens tremble.The sun and the moon are darkened,and the stars withhold their light.

11.verse: The Lord’s voice thundersat the head of his army.Mighty and numerous are his forces,and they enforce his orders.Great is the day of the Lordand exceedingly terrible;who can endure it?

12.verse: Rend Your Hearts and Not Your Garments -Yet even now, says the Lord,return to me with all your heart,with fasting, with weeping, and with mourning.

13.verse: Rend your hearts and not your garments,and turn back to the Lord, your God.For he is gracious and merciful,slow to anger, rich in kindness,and always prepared to relent from punishing.

14.verse: Perhaps he will turn back and relent,and leave a blessing behind him,cereal offerings and libationsto be presented to the Lord, your God.

15.verse: Blow the trumpet in Zion!Proclaim a fast!Announce a solemn assembly!

16.verse: Gather the people together;summon the community;assemble the elders;gather the children,even infants at the breast.Call forth the bridegroom from his bedroomand the bride from her wedding chamber.

17.verse: Let the priests, the ministers of the Lord,stand weeping, between the temple porch and the altar,as they say, “Spare your people, O Lord,and do not allow your heritage to be mockedand subjected to the contempt of the nations.Why should the peoples say‘Where is their God?’ ”Rejoice in the Lord Your God. -

18.verse: Thereupon, the Lord was stirred to feel concern for his land, and he took pity on his people.

19.verse: In response to their request, the Lord said to his people:I will send yougrain and wine and oil,and you will have all you need.Never again will I expose youto the contempt of the nations.

20.verse: I shall drive the northern army far from youand banish them to an arid and desolate land,with their vanguard toward the eastern sea,and their rearguard toward the western sea.They will give off a stench,and a foul stench will rise up.

21.verse: Fear not, O land;be glad and rejoice,for the Lord has done great things.

22.verse: Be not afraid, you beasts of the field,for the open pastures are green once again.The trees will bear fruit;the fig tree and the vine will yield a full harvest.

23.verse: O children of Zion, be glad,and rejoice in the Lord, your God.For he has given you food in good measureby sending you rain,the autumn and spring rains as before.

24.verse: The threshing floors will be full of grain,and the vats will overflow with wine and oil.

25.verse: I will repay you for the yearsthat the swarming locust has eaten,the hopping, the destroying, and the cutting locust,my great army which I sent against you.

26.verse: You will eat until you are satisfied,and you will praise the name of the Lord, your God,for he has dealt wondrously with you,and my people will never again be put to shame.

27.verse: And you shall knowthat I am in the midst of Israel.I am the Lord, your God, and there is no other;my people shall never again be put to shame.

1.verse: The Advent of New Times -Chapter 3 -I Will Pour Out My Spirit on All Mankind -After this,I will pour out my Spirit on all mankind.Your sons and your daughters will prophesy;your old men shall dream dreams,and your young men shall see visions.

2.verse: Even on the male and female slavesI will pour out my Spirit in those days.

3.verse: I will show portentsin the heavens and on the earth,blood and fire and columns of smoke.

4.verse: The sun will be turned to darknessand the moon to bloodbefore the coming of the day of the Lord,that great and terrible day.

5.verse: Then everyone will be savedwho calls on the name of the Lord.For on Mount Zionthere will be a remnant,as the Lord has said,and in Jerusalem there will be survivorswhom the Lord will call.
